channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sam Altman says OpenAI has $20B ARR and about $1.4 trillion in data center commitments
item.description: Altman named a long list of upcoming business he thinks will generate significant revenue.

item.title: What to Do in St. Paul and Minneapolis If You’re Here for Business (2025)
item.description: Where to stay, play, eat, and work, while on a business trip to Minneapolis and St. Paul.

item.title: Best Home Depot Black Friday Deals
item.description: Black Friday lasts a month this year at The Home Depot, including half off select tools and tool sets.

item.title: Sam Altman says he doesn’t want the government to bail out OpenAI if it fails
item.description: The furor over Sarah Friar's comments grew so loud that Trump's AI Czar David Sacks weighed in.

item.title: Amazon launches an AI-powered Kindle Translate service for ebook authors
item.description: Kindle Translate, an AI-powered translation service, is designed to broaden the reach of ebook authors.

item.title: 25 WIRED-Approved Gifts for Frequent Travelers (2025)
item.description: For the frequent flier who treats the Delta Sky Club like their second home.

item.title: Meta estimates that it earns 10% of its revenue from scams, report says
item.description: These fraudulent ads purport to offer a product or service that isn't actually real, and may be intended to solicit payments from less savvy users.

item.title: Peloton recalls 833,000 bikes after reports of injuries
item.description: The Consumer Product Safety Commission is warning Peloton users to stop using the affected bikes immediately.

item.title: Mastodon’s latest software update brings quote posts to all server operators
item.description: Mastodon's latest software version brings quote posts with added controls to all servers.

item.title: Google to buy carbon credits from massive Amazonian reforestation project
item.description: The deal is the first selected by the Symbiosis Coalition, an advance market commitment founded to seed the market for nature-based carbon removal.
